main event: Trained personnel observed an unknown circular, disc-like, silver object that moved at a high rate of speed over St. Louis, Missouri on July 26, 1954.
interesting points: The object was estimated to be 30 to 50 feet in diameter.
It moved westerly, then reversed direction and traveled easterly, before disappearing in a north-easterly direction.
The total observation time was approximately 2 to 2.5 minutes, occurring between 9:10 and 9:15 PM.
The observers believed the object to be of an unusual nature and unknown origin.
The report was distributed to multiple military commands, including the Air Force, Air Defense Command, and Air Technical Intelligence Center.
